name: trigger_job
description: Trigger a Jenkins job with optional parameters. Supports nested job paths like 'folder1/subfolder/jobname'.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name or path of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: params
arguments.desc: Job parameters. For multiselect parameters, pass as a list.

name: get_job_info
description: Get detailed information about a Jenkins job including its parameters. Supports nested job paths and automatic search fallback.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name or path of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: auto_search
arguments.desc: If True, perform pattern search when direct lookup fails (default: true)

name: get_build_status
description: Get the status of a specific build. Supports nested job paths.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number

name: get_console_log
description: Get console log for a specific build. Supports nested job paths.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number

arguments.name: start
arguments.desc: Starting byte position for fetching the log (default: 0)

name: list_jobs
description: List Jenkins jobs with optional recursive traversal and advanced filtering.

arguments.name: recursive
arguments.desc: If True, recursively traverse folders (default: true)

arguments.name: max_depth
arguments.desc: Maximum depth to recurse when recursive=True (default: 10)

arguments.name: include_folders
arguments.desc: Whether to include folder items in results (default: false)

arguments.name: status_filter
arguments.desc: Filter by job status: building, queued, idle, disabled

arguments.name: last_build_result
arguments.desc: Filter by last build result: SUCCESS, FAILURE, UNSTABLE, ABORTED, NOT_BUILT

arguments.name: days_since_last_build
arguments.desc: Only include jobs built within the last N days

arguments.name: enabled_only
arguments.desc: If True, only include enabled jobs; if False, only disabled jobs

name: get_folder_info
description: Get information about a specific Jenkins folder.

arguments.name: folder_path
arguments.desc: Path to the folder (e.g., 'folder1/subfolder')

name: search_jobs
description: Search for Jenkins jobs using pattern matching with advanced filtering.

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.desc: Pattern to match job names (supports wildcards or regex)

arguments.name: job_type
arguments.desc: Filter by type: job, folder, all (default: job)

arguments.name: max_depth
arguments.desc: Maximum depth to search (default: 10)

arguments.name: use_regex
arguments.desc: If True, treat pattern as regular expression (default: false)

arguments.name: status_filter
arguments.desc: Filter by job status: building, queued, idle, disabled

arguments.name: last_build_result
arguments.desc: Filter by last build result: SUCCESS, FAILURE, UNSTABLE, ABORTED, NOT_BUILT

arguments.name: days_since_last_build
arguments.desc: Only include jobs built within the last N days

arguments.name: enabled_only
arguments.desc: Filter by enabled/disabled status

name: search_and_trigger
description: Search for a job by pattern and trigger it if exactly one match is found.

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.desc: Pattern to match job names

arguments.name: params
arguments.desc: Job parameters for triggering

arguments.name: max_depth
arguments.desc: Maximum search depth (default: 10)

name: get_queue_info
description: Get information about queued builds.

name: server_info
description: Get Jenkins server information.

name: summarize_build_log
description: Summarizes the console log of a Jenkins build using a configured LLM prompt (demonstration tool).

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number

name: get_pipeline_status
description: Gets detailed pipeline stage status for a Jenkins Pipeline job build.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number

name: list_build_artifacts
description: List all artifacts for a specific Jenkins build.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number to list artifacts for

name: download_build_artifact
description: Download a specific build artifact content (text-based artifacts only for safety).

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: Build number containing the artifact

arguments.name: artifact_path
arguments.desc: Relative path to the artifact (from list_build_artifacts)

arguments.name: max_size_mb
arguments.desc: Maximum file size to download in MB (default: 50)

name: search_build_artifacts
description: Search for artifacts across recent builds of a job using pattern matching.

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Name of the Jenkins job to search

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.desc: Pattern to match artifact names (wildcards or regex)

arguments.name: max_builds
arguments.desc: Maximum number of recent builds to search (default: 10)

arguments.name: use_regex
arguments.desc: If True, treat pattern as regex (default: false)

name: batch_trigger_jobs
description: Trigger multiple Jenkins jobs in batch with parallel execution.

arguments.name: operations
arguments.desc: List of job operations with job_name, params, and optional priority (1-10)

arguments.name: max_concurrent
arguments.desc: Maximum number of concurrent job triggers (default: 5)

arguments.name: fail_fast
arguments.desc: If True, stop processing on first failure (default: false)

arguments.name: wait_for_completion
arguments.desc: If True, wait for all jobs to complete (default: false)

name: batch_monitor_jobs
description: Monitor the status of a batch operation and its individual jobs.

arguments.name: operation_id
arguments.desc: The operation ID returned from batch_trigger_jobs

name: batch_cancel_jobs
description: Cancel a batch operation and optionally cancel running builds.

arguments.name: operation_id
arguments.desc: The operation ID to cancel

arguments.name: cancel_running_builds
arguments.desc: If True, attempt to cancel running builds (default: false)

name: get_cache_statistics
description: Get comprehensive cache statistics and performance metrics.

name: clear_cache
description: Clear caches with fine-grained control.

arguments.name: cache_type
arguments.desc: Type of cache to clear: all, static, semi_static, dynamic, permanent, short

arguments.name: job_name
arguments.desc: Clear caches for a specific job only

name: warm_cache
description: Warm up caches by pre-loading frequently accessed data.

arguments.name: operations
arguments.desc: List of operations to warm: server_info, job_list, queue_info
